text_translated.47: @linditaperpetuo @angelamrobledo @Estamos_Listas 2. Insisting on the natural roles of mothers and that babies need moms more than dads only perpetuates an uneven distribution of care.
text_translated.48: @linditaperpetuo @angelamrobledo @Estamos_Listas 1. Maternity leave of 18 weeks is 1 below the OECD average. While paternity leave is today 7 weeks below the OECD average.
text_translated.49: @linditaperpetuo @angelamrobledo @Estamos_Listas Hi Marcela, this is not true. Women don't waste weeks with this project. Paternity leave is extended to 8 weeks and care roles are shared. Some answers to the arguments of Angela's thread:

text_translated.81: #AEstaHora Start the joint session of @ComisionPrimera of @CamaraColombia and @PrimeraSenado. Eye! 🚨 For today, the project that calls for powers to expand the Office of the Attorney General's Office is quoted. Follow #EnVivo the session here 👉🏽 https://t.co/UzgYQjxClw https://t.co/qkRf5jBfuo
text_translated.82: @DiosYLey @lucaspom @SebastianNohra @mafsul @lopezjosedaniel False. @SenadoGovCo Because it's not concurrent. During those 8 weeks parents would have to take care of their children alone.
text_translated.83: #PorSiTeLoPerdiste | We were in @WRadioColombia talking about #LicenciaCompartidaYa Today one of the main factors of unproductivity in our economy is discrimination in women's access to work. We have unemployment of 8.3 pp above men. https://t.co/fkuGqcNUqr
text_translated.84: #AEstaHora The Seventh Committee session of @SenadoGovCo begins. First of the agenda is our #LicenciaCompartidaYa project. Follow #EnVivo discussion here 👉🏽 https://t.co/DatPPQ6ziM https://t.co/BV3x5yDOy8
text_translated.85: #AEstaHora We are at @WRadioColombia talking about the #LicenciaCompartidaYa project. Listen here to the interview 👉🏽 https://t.co/CL7UPShmFH
text_translated.87: I read people writing that the #LicenciaCompartidaYa project is not a priority at this juncture of pandemic, unemployment and economic crisis. Of course it is! Of young people who neither study nor work 66.7 per cent are women. Female unemployment is 8.3pp higher than men. https://t.co/um0W6YgPl8
text_translated.88: @SebastianNohra @lucaspom @mafsul @SenadoGovCo But the Treasury is opposing and if it does not come out this week of the seventh committee of the senate, it sinks us. @lopezjosedaniel
text_translated.89: @PETEAGC Addressing unemployment among women and particularly young women does have to be a priority https://t.co/3bbXqgMnCX
text_translated.92: @anca511 @SwedeninCOL @mluciaramirez @dgomezco @lopezjosedaniel Addressing unemployment among women and particularly young women does have to be a priority https://t.co/3bbXqgMnCX @GabrielSantosCD
text_translated.94: Attentive to today's agenda: 📌 At 8:00am will be the 3rd debate of the #LicenciaCompartidaYa draft in Commission 7th of @SenadoGovCo. 📌 At 3:00pm the @CamaraColombia Plenary is quoted for the vote from #MociónDeCensura to MinDefensa. https://t.co/WqxGWu7rVc https://t.co/A0tX17XYJH
text_translated.95: Tomorrow at 8 am do not miss the 3rd debate of the #LicenciaCompartidaYa project, which extends paternity leave from 10 days to 8 weeks, and allows 6 weeks of maternity to be shared by will. Equity in employment depends on equity in care. https://t.co/0jvD32nFAR
text_translated.96: “The initiative is waiting to be discussed in the third debate, and according to its authors, if it is not processed tomorrow, it must be archived by times.” #LicenciaCompartidaYa https://t.co/omsSljK4F3
text_translated.97: @Calma_Tiempo Okay. That's why we made an archive paper on this project. We were defeated today, but we're going to keep fighting.
text_translated.98: At least we managed with @lopezjosedaniel and @GabrielSantosCD's proposal to remove this article. https://t.co/O7MozdSWVK
text_translated.99: I regret the decision of the First Committee to adopt this draft. Although the endorsement of these two proposals reduces the risks of censorship, it does NOT develop a catalogue of contents to avoid arbitrary limitations on freedom of expression. Public hearing is urgent. https://t.co/ji7htGzfmS
text_translated.100: #AEstaHora Start the @ComisionPrimera of @CamaraColombia. Follow #EnVivo the debate here 👉🏽 https://t.co/nPCi5ir1Uz 🚨 Pending! Today is the first on the agenda the project that regulates content for children and adolescents 👇🏽 https://t.co/BSv2beHUhC
text_translated.101: #AEstaHora Accidental Commission to follow up the vaccination plan in Colombia against #Covid_19 begins. Follow #EnVivo the session here 👉🏽 https://t.co/3PVFIyiTug https://t.co/qZBrf85egt
text_translated.102: 🗓️👇🏽 #PorLaTransparencia | Here you can see our agenda today: https://t.co/WqxGWu7rVc At 2:00 p.m. we will be meeting at @ComisionPrimera from @CamaraColombia, quoted for discussion and voting on projects. https://t.co/wxl3H9CDwa
text_translated.103: Today is a perfect day to see Seetle of Beetles from @MargaritaM. Family stories and personal effort behind our best cyclists. 📺 | https://t.co/acVtu2pQtQ https://t.co/AskVSmH0NK
text_translated.104: Thank you, Egan! Thank you, Dani! 🚲🇨🇴
text_translated.105: Good @elespectador editorial and beautiful photo: “Without clear and implementable agreements, what has happened so many other times in Colombia can happen: that social transformations be aborted because of violence.” https://t.co/cwn4iP12of
text_translated.106: Highly recommended column by @hectorabadf: “Some colleagues see in the revolt the dawn of the revolution. A reformist like me thinks what we need is to give these young people, who rightly protest, a reason to believe in a better future.” https://t.co/g1nAso7hOR
text_translated.107: This decree, in addition to not solving the problem, is unconstitutional: 1. Violates territorial autonomy 2. Prioritizes military action over police in internal disturbances 3. Indiscriminate use of curfew 4. De facto takes commotion measures but avoids constitutional control https://t.co/tUzfBRhAfb
text_translated.108: End our listening day for #LosJóvenesTienenLaPalabra in #Ibagué. They call for clarification of human rights violations and that the government go to its People's Assemblies. Priorities: 1. Reform the police 2. Get out the corrupt 3. Citizen participation 4. Decriminalize protest https://t.co/xS5ZfKZig9
text_translated.109: There are 1.2 billion pesos for rural development in municipalities most affected by war and poverty blocked by the DNP and control bodies. In a multi-party way we ask the government to expedite its approval. 👉🏽 https://t.co/KlOqlgYkog https://t.co/4eS2fFuk4R
text_translated.110: #AEstaHora Start the meeting with young people in Ibagué. Here you can connect to follow #EnVivo session 👉🏽 https://t.co/WdHk11rSUu #LosJóvenesTienenLaPalabra https://t.co/dweEMQorLX
text_translated.111: Here you can find out the agenda 👇🏽 #LosJóvenesTienenLaPalabra https://t.co/DHIXgueI8E
text_translated.112: Today we will have our third multi-party encounter of #LosJóvenesTienenLaPalabra in #Ibagué. We're going to be listening to them and talking about education, opportunities and guarantees for peaceful protest. 32.29% of the city's youth are unemployed 👇🏽 https://t.co/m5jhocX7Uj
